name: Sneha Joshi
warning_signs: Severe swelling in legs, ankles, or face
Decreased urine output or dark-colored urine
follow_up_instructions: Report any signs of infection immediately
Restrict fluid intake to 1.5 liters per day
Limit sodium intake to 2000mg per day
Monitor blood pressure daily and log readings
Attend dialysis sessions as scheduled (3 times per week)
discharge_summary:
Patient Sneha Joshi was admitted on 2025-09-21 with Acute Kidney Injury. 
During hospitalization, patient was managed with Sevelamer 800mg with meals, Metoprolol 50mg twice daily, Atorvastatin 20mg at bedtime. 
Procedures performed included Peritoneal dialysis catheter insertion.
Patient's condition improved and was stable at discharge. 
Discharged home with instructions to follow up with nephrologist and continue medications as prescribed. 
Patient educated on warning signs and dietary restrictions.
